page.title: 15Social Concerns in Beckermet
page.content: Sellafield, the Atomic Energy Complex caused many local problems. One of these was the volume of traffic which travelled through the village of Beckermet at the start and finish of each shift. The construction of a new road skirting the village has alleviated this problem considerably. Another problem was the pollution of the local beaches in 1983 by radioactive effluent which had been leaking into the Irish Sea from the chemical reprocessing site. This meant that all the local beaches were closed to the public for that summer. They are still being closely monitored. The high incidence of childhood cancer cases in the nearby area is also being attributed to Sellafield. This has yet to be established.
